title: Iterative Design Process Workshop for Enhancing Online Education Accessibility

context.prior_knowledge: Experience with basic online learning platforms and introductory understanding of digital educational content creation
context.additional_context: Training in designing accessible online content for language education, with digital devices (tablets/laptops) provided and iterative design processes practiced through offline collaboration

learning_goals: Learners can diagnose at least three accessibility issues using an online educational content evaluation tool compliant with WCAG 2.1 standards.
Learners can revise digital language-learning content at least twice following an iterative design process and measure accessibility improvements.
Learners can collect accessibility requirements from a small learner group and create a prototype design document reflecting them.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
